page.title: 18Exford Blacksmiths
page.content: The Smithy is situated almost opposite the hunt stables to which it is closely associated. It has stood in the village since 1930 and the Kents have worked in the forge since the 17th Century. John Kent now works in the forge with three other men,shoeing horses and carrying out general ironmongery, for example repairs and wrought iron work. There is also a small Hardware shop next to the forge. On average between 30 and 40 horses are shod each week. Many horses are shod outside the forge within the district,between 70 and 80 a week. The horse shoes come from Sheffield and range from a heavy horse to a donkey size. The Smith is busy all year round and visitors are welcome to watch.
